Our story

In 2011, a small group of bike enthusiasts had a dream of building jumps. With the support of the Cosumnes Community Services District (CSD), Elk Grove Bike Park was born. With the enduring support of the CSD and volunteers, the park has grown over the years to acompany beginners to expert riders and everyone in between. Our main goals are to continue to increase accessibility of the park, while sharing the love for bikes and building an awesome and inclusive community of riders

The bike park is free and open every day from early morning until dusk. THE BIKE PARK WILL BE CLOSED IF IT'S MUDDY. Donations to the donation box near the bike park entrance are greatly appreciated! Please join the bike park Facebook group and Instagram to find out the latest information about events and volunteer dig days. Volunteers can earn community service hours for school, scouts, court ordered, etc. by building/weeding during our build sessions.

Location

Park Rules

  • Respect fellow riders.
  • Ride within your abilities. Start small and ride within your limits.
  • Bikes only! No RC cars, scooters, hoverboards, skateboards, motorized vehicles, etc.
  • No climbing, running, sitting, standing on jumps
  • Don't ride or walk in between or stand behind jumps!

Help keep the park looking and riding smooth!

The summertime heat can be expecially rough on jumps. Please water the jumps before you ride! If you have more time, you can sweep the jumps and/or tracks as well. Do not sweep/work on the gap jump lines. Doing repairs on those is best left to the more experienced volunteers. If that’s you go for it, if not please leave them alone.

  • STEP 1 Insert water spike to pressurize hoser
  • STEP 2 Lightly water top of element just enough so that water doesn’t drain down

  • Step 3

  • Using a push broom sweep dust from base of element into the wetted area (Repeat)

  • Step 4

  • Lightly mist water on newly broomed area

  • Step 5 IMPORTANT

  • Uninstall hose. We never want to leave a hose pressurized as a rupture could flood and close the bike park.

  • Step 6

  • Let dry slightly

  • Step 7

  • Ride your Bike!
